item.title: Factors associated with vaccination for hepatitis B, pertussis, seasonal and pandemic influenza among French general practitioners: a 2010 survey
item.description: 27% of doctor’s families were not vaccinated against hepatitis B, 36% were not vaccinated against whooping cough, 23% were not vaccinated against influenza. (France)

item.title: Knowledge, attitudes, beliefs and practices of general practitioners towards measles and MMR vaccination in southeastern France in 2012
item.description: 13% of doctors do not consider measles a dangerous disease. 12% of doctors consider the second dose of MMR to be useless. 33% of doctors do not believe that MMR vaccination should be mandatory for children under 2 years of age. (France)

item.title: Waning immunity against mumps in vaccinated young adults, France 2013
item.description: In 2013, 15 mumps outbreaks were registered in France. 72% of the cases had been vaccinated twice. The effectiveness of the vaccine was 49% for one dose and 55% for two doses. Among those who had been vaccinated once, the risk of getting mumps increased by 7% for every year that had passed since the vaccination. Among those who had been vaccinated twice, the risk of getting mumps increased by 10% for every year that had passed after the second dose.
